## Load Packages & Data

```{r setup, include=FALSE}

knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(tidymodels)
library(palmerpenguins)

penguins %>%
  head()

penguins %>%
  summarize(across(.cols = everything(), ~sum(is.na(.))))

penguins %>%
  filter(is.na(sex))

## Remove the two observations with all data missing
penguins_cleaned <- penguins %>%
  filter(!is.na(bill_depth_mm))

```


## Split Data

**Train/Test Split**

```{r}
set.seed(6923)
penguin_split <- initial_split(penguins_cleaned, strata = "species")

train <- training(penguin_split)
test <- testing(penguin_split)

```


**Cross Validation**

```{r}
set.seed(3344)
cv_folds <- vfold_cv(
  data = train, 
  v = 5
  ) 

cv_folds
```


## Model Specification

```{r}

rf_fit <- rand_forest(
    mtry = tune()
  ) %>%
  set_engine("randomForest", importance = TRUE) %>%
  set_mode("classification")

rf_tune_grid <- grid_regular(
   mtry(range = c(1,5)),
  levels = 5)

```


## Recipe


```{r}

penguins_rec <- recipe(
  species ~ .,
  data = train
  ) %>%
  step_impute_knn(
    sex,
    neighbors = 3
  ) %>% 
  update_role(
    year, island,
    new_role = "ID"
  )


## rows 7 and 8 have NA
train

## Notice that they are now fixed
penguins_rec %>% 
  prep() %>% 
  bake(new_data = NULL)

```


## Workflow

```{r}

penguins_wf <- workflow() %>% 
  add_recipe(penguins_rec) %>% 
  add_model(rf_fit)

```


## Fit Model on Training Data


```{r}

doParallel::registerDoParallel()

set.seed(582)

tune_rf <- tune_grid(
  penguins_wf,
  resamples = cv_folds,
  grid = rf_tune_grid,
  # grid = 5
)

tune_rf


collect_metrics(tune_rf)
autoplot(tune_rf)
select_best(tune_rf, "roc_auc")

```


**Finalize the model, keep workflow**

```{r}
penguins_wf_final <- finalize_workflow(penguins_wf, select_best(tune_rf, "roc_auc"))

```

**Fit the final model to the training data**

```{r}

penguins_fit_final <- penguins_wf_final %>% 
  last_fit(
    split = penguin_split
  )

penguins_fit_final

## plot the variables of importance
library(vip)

penguins_fit_final %>%
  extract_fit_parsnip() %>% 
  vip(geom = "col",
      aesthetics = list(
              color = "black",
              fill = "palegreen",
              alpha = 0.5)) +
  theme_classic()

```


## Make Predictions on Test Data

```{r}

fit_test <- penguins_fit_final %>% 
  collect_predictions()

fit_test

# Model was 100% accurate on test data? That doesn't make sense.
table(
  actual = fit_test$species,
  predicted = fit_test$.pred_class
  )

```


## Evaluate Model Performance

```{r}
## Collect metrics
collect_metrics(penguins_fit_final)


## plot of prediction vs true outcome

fit_test %>%
  roc_curve(
    truth = species,
    .pred_Adelie, .pred_Chinstrap, .pred_Gentoo
  ) %>% 
  autoplot()

```
